title: Share executable among multiple extensions
body:
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Some extensions are all dependent on same executable to provide same functionality. E.g.

C/C++ extension is bundled with a clang-format executable to support formatting.

vscode-proto3 needs clang-format but is not included in the extension package. Thus, users are required to install clang-format system-wide and configure it. To do so 
```
$ sudo apt install clang-format                                                                   
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
The following additional packages will be installed:
  adduser apt apt-utils clang-format-10 debconf debconf-i18n debianutils dh-python dpkg file gnupg gpgv
  init-system-helpers libacl1 libapt-inst2.0 libapt-pkg5.0 libattr1 libaudit-common libaudit1 libbsd0
  libbz2-1.0 libclang-cpp10 libdb5.3 libedit2 libexpat1 libffi6 libgcrypt20 libgpg-error0 libgpm2
  libllvm10 liblocale-gettext-perl liblz4-1 liblzma5 libmagic1 libmpdec2 libncursesw5 libpam-modules
  libpam-modules-bin libpam0g libpcre3 libpython3-stdlib libpython3.5-minimal libpython3.5-stdlib
  libreadline6 libselinux1 libsemanage-common libsemanage1 libsepol1 libsqlite3-0 libssl1.0.0 libsystemd0
  libtext-charwidth-perl libtext-iconv-perl libtext-wrapi18n-perl libtinfo5 libusb-0.1-4 libustr-1.0-1
  lsb-base mime-support multiarch-support passwd perl-base python3 python3-minimal python3.5
  python3.5-minimal readline-common sensible-utils tar ubuntu-keyring update-motd zlib1g
Suggested packages:
  perl-modules ecryptfs-utils aptitude | synaptic | wajig dpkg-dev apt-doc python-apt debconf-doc
  debconf-utils whiptail | dialog libterm-readline-gnu-perl libgtk2-perl libnet-ldap-perl perl
  libqtgui4-perl libqtcore4-perl libdpkg-perl gnupg-curl gnupg-doc libpcsclite1 parcimonie xloadimage
  | imagemagick | eog rng-tools gpm libpam-doc python3-doc python3-tk python3-venv python3.5-venv
  python3.5-doc binutils binfmt-support readline-doc bzip2 ncompress xz-utils tar-scripts
The following NEW packages will be installed:
  adduser apt apt-utils clang-format clang-format-10 debconf debconf-i18n debianutils dh-python dpkg file
  gnupg gpgv init-system-helpers libacl1 libapt-inst2.0 libapt-pkg5.0 libattr1 libaudit-common libaudit1
  libbsd0 libbz2-1.0 libclang-cpp10 libdb5.3 libedit2 libexpat1 libffi6 libgcrypt20 libgpg-error0 libgpm2
  libllvm10 liblocale-gettext-perl liblz4-1 liblzma5 libmagic1 libmpdec2 libncursesw5 libpam-modules
  libpam-modules-bin libpam0g libpcre3 libpython3-stdlib libpython3.5-minimal libpython3.5-stdlib
  libreadline6 libselinux1 libsemanage-common libsemanage1 libsepol1 libsqlite3-0 libssl1.0.0 libsystemd0
  libtext-charwidth-perl libtext-iconv-perl libtext-wrapi18n-perl libtinfo5 libusb-0.1-4 libustr-1.0-1
  lsb-base mime-support multiarch-support passwd perl-base python3 python3-minimal python3.5
  python3.5-minimal readline-common sensible-utils tar ubuntu-keyring update-motd zlib1g
0 upgraded, 73 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Need to get 41.1 MB of archives.
After this operation, 186 MB of additional disk space will be used.
```
186MB is required. Even worse, sometime you are not `sudoer` to do this. Sometime you work on another remote machine that have different path and you need to reconfigure the executable path. Simply because the bundled clang-format is not accessible by other extension. I can config them to the exact path, but there is a version number in the path so I need to update them again and again. Is it possible to make bundled executable accessible by others? That is, some extensions provide executables, other extensions reference it.

title: UI blanks out portion of screen
body:
In the last several releases of VScode (going back to about v1.35) , I periodically experience an issue with the user interface where the top 10-15% of my screen (from about the search icon up) goes completely white or black and nothing on the portion of the screen responds to the mouse. 
'Alt' key does not access the menus so that I can move or resize the window. Restarting VScode does not the resolve the issue. Display is fine because moving another window to same position results in full functionality. 

VScode v1.35 through 1.39
Win10
Disabling all extensions does not resolve the issue.

title: Wrong state of Maximize/Restore button after exiting Fullscreen and then Restoring window

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
Using VS Code 1.39.1 on Windows 10, here are the steps to reproduce:

1. Start with a normal, non-maximized window.
2. Maximize the window. The maximize button in the top right turns into a Restore button (as expected).
3. Hit F11 to enable Fullscreen.
4. Hit F11 again to disable Fullscreen.
5. Click the Restore button to return to a non-maximized window.
6. Notice that the Restore button has not gone back to being a Maximize button. Instead, it remains as a Restore button (not expected).

x64

OSX 10.14.6 (18G103)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Enter the following in Bash `code ./subfolder` (where `.` is a workspace folder)
2. Observe that all workspace settings for `.` have been effaced in the new window that opens. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

This seems like something that should Just Work^tm

How do we get this to work?  Is this a bug or a missing configuration?

title: Webview panel does not remove on dispose()
body:
I see that a bug has not been fixed yet. See https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/58360

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.13

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open empty window
2. Add 1st folder to a workspace
3. Add 2nd folder to a workspace 
4. Open WebView, keep its instance and close when any folder is removed from workspace 
```
    this.subscriptions.push(
      vscode.workspace.onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders(this.disposePanel.bind(this))
    );
```

See full code to reproduce https://github.com/platformio/platformio-vscode-ide/blob/develop/src/home.js

We have a lot of reports, every time I close them and ask users to open an issue here. See the latest https://github.com/platformio/platformio-vscode-ide/issues/1048

P.S: I did another research and added debugging here https://github.com/platformio/platformio-vscode-ide/blob/develop/src/home.js#L138:L145

The code calls, but tab does not remove.

Do we have any API in VScode to list opened tabs and close them based on their type/title?

title: git index file gets locked on local network server
body:
- VSCode Version:  1.39.1
- OS Version: MacOS High-Sierra

We have a Ubuntu Server in our network where we work on our projects.
When I work on some files in VS code and try to stage them via vscode git plugin, CLI or a GIT Client (GitKraken) I get the error "index file locked". Then I delete the index file, clean up after that (because after deleting the index file and staging 1 File, all files are marked as deleted, so I unstage everything and everything is good again) Then I can stage files and commit them.

Then I continue with my work, do some code and try to stage/commit again. And then the error appears again.

When I disable the GIT plugin via `"git.enabled": false`  in the `settings.json` then the problem never appear.

However I would like to have the git feature in vscode to see my changes and untracked files .. So what could cause the problem?

title: Extension proxy doe not tunnel https to http
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run VS Code behind a proxy with HTTPS_PROXY set to an http url
2. Use the Atlascode or any extension that makes https calls

Expected: the requests work
Actual: the requests fail. Most of the time the error reported is "socket hang up"

I believe the chromium proxy stuff internally handles tunneling https to http when running behind an http proxy, However, I don't think VS Code handles this when it rewrites the https module for extension proxy support.

We've been able to get around this by adding this to our axios requests when behind a proxy:

```
const [host, port] = getProxyHostAndPort();

                let numPort = undefined;
                if (host.trim() !== '') {
                    if (port.trim() !== '') {
                        numPort = parseInt(port);
                    }
                    agent = {
                        httpsAgent: tunnel.httpsOverHttp({
                            proxy: {
                                host: host,
                                port: numPort
                            }
                        }), proxy: false
                    };
                }
```

It would be ideal if VS Code just handled this for extensions.

title: Add wordSeperator in config for integrated terminal (xterm)
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please: 
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests.
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `master` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them. 
-->

This PR fixes #82173

A new section `Terminal`->`Integrated`->`Word Separator` has been added to the config with a default value of ` ()[]{}'",`. This value is further passed to the xterm.js constructor.

title: Regression with Ctr+F when large data is Selected
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.14.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file in VS Code
2. Select a large portion of the file
3. Hit Ctrl+F for search
4. Ctrl + F autopopulates data from selection
5. VSCode hangs.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

While a possible work around is to disable the setting "Seed Search String From Selection", vscode could prevent accidental triggering of search with large seeds that would definitely crash.

title: How to debounce when the  provideCompletionItems is triggered in high frequency
body:
- description:
I add implement of provideCompletionItems， and it will provide some customize items. when the function of provideCompletionItems id trggered, firstly, i send the restful service to acquire data for completionItems. now my question is that: the restful service is sent in high frequency, this is not reasonable, I want to debounce  when the  provideCompletionItems is triggered in high frequency 
I tried to set the property: quickSuggestionsDelay, but not worked。the "quickSuggestionsDelay" is woeked for native completion actions, not for customize.

git-graph | mhu | 1.17.0
code-beautifier | mic | 2.3.3
vscode-docker | ms- | 0.8.1
LiveServer | rit | 5.6.1
code-settings-sync | Sha | 3.4.3
laravel-goto-controller | ste | 0.0.7
errorlens | use | 2.7.1

**Steps to Reproduce**:
1. Do not have an instance of your default browser running
2. Open a link from Visual Studio Code

**Expected Behaviour**:
An instance of my default browser gets opened showing the clicked link.

**Actual Outcome**:
It kind of worked as expected but the browser instance gets stacked as a VS Code instance in the taskbar. Opening more browser instances (e.g. File > New Window) will also collect them as Code instances. Happened the first time while clicking the "If you'd like to read these release notes online, go to Updates on code.visualstudio.com." link on the "Release Notes" page but can also occur when opening the "MDN Reference" link while hovering over a CSS property.

![Step2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45714854/66635586-d2fd7000-ec0f-11e9-8404-9f601ba539a0.png)

![Step3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45714854/66635628-ea3c5d80-ec0f-11e9-9cfe-e07fb9248798.png)

The browser works normal it just gets sorted as VS Code instance. At first I even thought it is some kind of new build in browsing feature but stacking the new browser windows under the VS Code icon is not an intended behaviour, I guess :wink:

title: Debug: Support launch config grouping and sorting
body:
It would be cool to support grouping in the debug launch configs, such that we can minimize the noise in the picker:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/66636353-51a6dd00-ec11-11e9-805c-fca2e3003055.png)

One idea is to mimic the menu API: https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/contribution-points#Sorting-inside-groups

We could support a `group` option which would allow to join launch configs together as well as sort them.

We can even have special groups like `commandPalette` which means that the launch config should only appear in the command palette.

title: CSS property completion with semicolon should place cursor at the end after inserting value
body:
This is pretty self-explanatory. Before "CSS property completion with semicolon" was added my workflow was okay, the feature was really missing(!) but:

1. inserted `colo`
2. selected color from dropdown
3.  inserted `red;`
4. pressed enter to go to next line for new prop

And now it is:

1. inserted `colo`
2. selected color from dropdown
3.  inserted `red`
4. move cursor one right
5. pressed enter to go to next line for new prop

So it's really making it worse now to move the cursor to go to the next line.

title: Expand "choice" functionality to multiline and variables
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I'm trying to create a more complex 'function' snippet, by allowing you to select different options for the signature after the snippet was selected.

For example, right now, I have a 'choice' for the visibility of the function, like
`${1|public,private,protected|}`

I want to be able to use the same functionality for the number of params and return type hints, including "none" as an option.

Right now, it seems like multiline code will break the 'choice' syntax, and $variables don't work as options.

Here's an example of what I'd like to be able to make work:

```
"Fancy function with options": {
	"scope": "php",
	"prefix": ["function", "func"],
	"body": [
		"/**",
		" *",
		" *",
		" * {|2@param $type $param,",
		" * @param $type1 $param1",
		" * @param $type2 $param2|}",
		" * {4|@return $returntype, |}",
		" */",
		"${1|public,private,protected|} function $functionName({3|$type $param, $type1 $param1\, $type2 $param2|}) {5|: $returntype, |} {",
		"    $0",
		"}"
	],
	"description": "Function"
},
```

This snippet would let me choose the visibility of the function
then how many params I show in the doc (1 or 2)
then how many params I show in the function (1 or 2)
then whether I return something in the doc
then whether there's a typehint on the function
then it would let me set the $returnType, $types, $params, and the $functionName
before dropping me off at $0.

I can achieve a similar result by implementing multiple snippets, but I would like something like what I described above.

PS: If this is already possible somehow, I apologize in advance; I couldn't make it work.
